item.title: Pathway restricted due to refuse bins blocking way . Prams , wheelchairs , elderly and disabled resort to use road . Unsafe especially at night, 4th February
item.description:
Due to the residents / abandoned bins the public footpath is hazardous , resorting to dome golf using the road to pass , dangerous especially at night .

item.title: This is a very big pot hole. 1-2 metres in side., 4th February
item.description:
My entire car drops when I drive passed this and there is no way of avoiding it. I am reporting as I do not want to cause any further damage to my car aswell as others.

item.title: Restricted pavement area to try and walk on as per previous report number 8796380, 4th February
item.description:
As reported before on report number 8796380, which has allegedly been fixed and closed but is in fact still UNFIXED, the width of pavement available to use is restricted by stones and muddy decaying leaves. This can clearly be seen on the attached photographs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, The Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken block paving at entrance to driveway, 4th February
item.description:
Following resurfacing works the block paving has sunken and sits below the tarmac line resulting in the collection of excessive sludge/rainwater and rainwater not running correctly down Queensway to roadside drains
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Queensway, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo on pavement - 4th time raising this, 4th February
item.description:
Once again there is an owner letting their dog poo on the pavement and not picking it up. It is always on the left side pavement of Westbury Road. I have put up 2 previous posts about this and nothing has been done so as you can imagine they continue to do it. It is dark in the morning when people are leaving for work so there’s a high likelihood someone will step in this. Please address this it’s been going on for a long time. Put up cameras and give them a fine or something instead of just marking this as fixed when you have done nothing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbury Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Blandford Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster

item.title: Fly-tipped building materials left in communal access/parking area, 4th February
item.description:
Large items of dumped furniture and panels have been left next to the building’s entrance door. The items appear to be discarded furniture/building materials and do not belong to any resident. They have been in this location for approximately two months (since before the New Year) and are next to the entrance. The waste requires removal.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover in road causing noise nuisance, 4th February
item.description:
This manhole cover is loose, and every time a car goes over it, it makes a lot of noise. This is often, and all day and night, as it is a very busy road. It is disturbing the peace of myself and neighbours and causing a noise nuisance, especially at night. It has been like this for several months now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on edge of speedbump, 4th February
item.description:
Getting worse by the day and almost unavoidable due to position at edge of speed bump

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nuisance bins, 4th February
item.description:
No 82 St Margaret's Terrace was illegally sub-divided into 7 flats some time ago. The residents have constantly misused their blue and green bins which now appear to have been confiscated, so there are only 4 black top bins between 7 flats. This picture doesn't show the worst of it but they are constantly overflowing, blocking the pavement and attract fly tipping. What is most annoying is they have a bin store which could hold these bins but it is unused and also full of rubbish. I have complained to the letting agent (The Property Experts) multiple times but they don't care and have hung up the phone on me and ignored emails! This problem has been going on for years and needs to be resolved.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Margarets Terrace, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely deep pot hole which I hit about 3 weeks ago and still hasn't been filled., 4th February
item.description:
Been there at least 3 weeks. Also a load of potholes at Crown point but not sure that is Southwark???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Hill, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Traffic calming speedbump has deteriorated, 4th February
item.description:
This speedbump has had it's forward edge chipped off significantly making it a danger to car tyres and suspension even at very low speeds. It needs restoring.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, Greater London

item.title: Tarmac damaged, 4th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Boundary Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
